ImageFunction.drawGlyph

Function/Meaning
Character Rendering
Type
Method of the ImageFunction class
Syntax
drawGlyph(bmp, x, y, glyph, color, opa=255, aa=true, face=dfAlpha, shadowlevel=0, shadowcolor=0x000000, shadowwidth=0, shadowofsx=0, shadowofsy=0, hda=false, cliprect=null)
Arguments
bmp Specifies the Bitmap object to draw the character on.
x Specifies the x-coordinate of the origin (in image coordinates) where character rendering starts, in pixels.
y Specifies the y-coordinate of the origin (in image coordinates) where character rendering starts, in pixels.
glyph Specifies the glyph to draw.
color Specifies the character color in 0xRRGGBB format.
opa Specifies the opacity of the character (-255 to 0 to 255).
Specifying a negative number is only valid when face is dfAlpha; in this case, opacity is removed in the shape of the character (smaller values have a greater effect).
aa Specifies whether to perform anti-aliasing.
If true, anti-aliasing is performed. If false, it is not.
face Specifies the rendering method.
If dfAlpha is specified, the image is treated as an image with an alpha channel.
If dfAddAlpha is specified, the image is treated as an image with an additive alpha channel.
If dfOpaque is specified, the image is treated as completely opaque.
shadowlevel Specifies the opacity of the shadow. The appropriate value varies depending on the shadowwidth argument.
If 0 is specified, no shadow is drawn.
shadowcolor Specifies the shadow color in 0xRRGGBB format.
shadowwidth Specifies the width (blur) of the shadow. 0 is the sharpest (no blur), and larger values blur the shadow.
shadowofsx Specifies the x-coordinate of the shadow position in pixels. If 0 is specified, the shadow is drawn directly below.
shadowofsy Specifies the y-coordinate of the shadow position in pixels. If 0 is specified, the shadow is drawn directly below.
hda Specifies whether to protect the alpha channel.
cliprect Specifies the clipping region as a Rect object (in Bitmap image coordinates).
If unspecified, the entire area is targeted.
Return Value
Rendering area (Rect object)
Description
Draws a glyph to the Bitmap.
When dfOpaque is specified for face, whether the destination mask is destroyed or protected depends on hda.
For the glyph, specify an array in a format like glyph : Array[9] = [ width, height, originx, originy, incx, incy, inc, bitmap(Octet), colors ].
If the glyph's colors are omitted, it is assumed to be 256 levels.
